text: Mariska Hargitay will shine the spotlight on her mother, actress Jayne Mansfield, in the documentary My Mom Jayne, premiering Friday, June 27 at 8/7c on HBO. “Mariska Hargitay was three years old when her mother, Jayne Mansfield, tragically died in a car accident at the age of 34,” reads the official description. “The film follows Mariska as she seeks to know, understand, and embrace her mother for the first time. Through intimate interviews and a collection of never-before-seen photos and home movies, she grapples with her mother’s public and private legacy and discovers the layers and depth of who Jayne was, not only to her audience but to those who were closest to her.” My Mom Jayne marks Hargitay’s directorial debut. html:
Mariska Hargitay will shine the spotlight on her mother, actress Jayne Mansfield, in the documentary My Mom Jayne, premiering Friday, June 27 at 8/7c on HBO.

“Mariska Hargitay was three years old when her mother, Jayne Mansfield, tragically died in a car accident at the age of 34,” reads the official description. “The film follows Mariska as she seeks to know, understand, and embrace her mother for the first time. Through intimate interviews and a collection of never-before-seen photos and home movies, she grapples with her mother’s public and private legacy and discovers the layers and depth of who Jayne was, not only to her audience but to those who were closest to her.”

My Mom Jayne marks Hargitay’s directorial debut.

In other recent scheduling news…

* The Great Escaper, the 2023 film that marked the final performances of both Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson, will air on PBS Masterpiece this fall, while the 2024 miniseries The Count of Monte Cristo, starring Sam Claflin (Daisy Jones & the Six), will premiere in 2026.

* Barbie Mysteries: Beach Detectives Season 2 will premiere Thursday, Aug. 28 on Netflix, featuring eight 25-minute episodes with five new original songs.

* The cast of the groundbreaking LGBTQ series Noah’s Arc will reunite for a new movie, Noah’s Arc: The Movie, premiering Friday, June 20 on Paramount+ With Showtime to mark the show’s 20th anniversary. Original stars Darryl Stephens, Rodney Chester, Doug Spearman, Christian Vincent, Jensen Atwood and WIlson Cruz are set to return. Watch a teaser here:
